book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.name: Brewing & Effects
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.another_:
Influences the drops when using [#](449900)Fortune[#]() to mine ores, [#](449900)Looting[#]() to kill mobs, or other luck-based enchantments.\
Each level of Another Roll will increase your chances of getting the highest amount possible.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.ascensio: The call of heaven, or something like that. A glorious, gathering of forces before [#](449900)Divinity[#]() kicks in.

Gives you major buffs to all your main attributes.\
At the ([close to](entry://creating_life/hardcore_revival)) irreversible cost of your life, should you die nonetheless.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.deadly_p: Normally, poison was something you had to be careful of, but there was never the possibility of being carried away by it. This more potent variant, on the other hand, *does* seek your life.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.effect_p: Increases the duration of other status effects applied to you.
Getting a level of Effect Prolonging will instead stack additional Levels on top of existing ones, increasing the effects Potency instead of resetting it's duration.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.frenzy.p: Damage, attack speed, movement speed and knockback resistance are buffed with each kill. The higher the effect's level, the higher the buff. Not scoring a kill in 10 seconds will debuff you instead.
Getting a level of Frenzy will instead stack additional Levels on top of existing ones, increasing the effect's Potency instead of resetting its duration.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.immunity: [#](449900)Removes all negative status effects[#](), when applied. Also prevents you from getting any new ones, as long as Immunity is active
Some effects seem to be powerful enough to resist your immunity.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.lava_gli: [#](449900)Increases your movement speed and visibility in Lava[#]() with each level.

Does, however, **NOT** protect you from Fire or Lava damage.\
\
*Calls for a slapstick sketch at your expense, doesn't it?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.life_dra:
Life Drain is a horrible thing that turned your stomach around.\
It slowly [#](449900)decreases your max hit points[#](), leaving you very vulnerable even against minuscule hits.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.lightwei:
[#](449900)Makes you a bit lighter[#]() with every level, allowing you to jump a bit further and fall slower.\
High levels will make you not take [#](449900)Fall Damage[#]() anymore.
[#](449900)Makes you heavier[#]() with every level, making you take increased fall damage and preventing you from making long jumps..
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.magic_an: [#](449900)Reduces incoming magic damage[#]() by 1 point per level. While minor damage will be less dangerous to you, big hitters will still very much pose a threat to you regardless.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.potion_w:
Since the [Potion Workshop](entry://brewing/potion_workshop)[#]() is basically an upgraded [#](bb00bb)Brewing Stand[#](), you are able to create all the [#](bb00bb)Potion variants[#]() that were available to you before, too.\
In addition, the possibility to use magic items as ingredients opens new doors for you.\
\
Some of them are easier or harder to get enhanced effects from.

Create [#](bb00bb)Potions[#]() by using the same ingredients as you would in the vanilla [#](bb00bb)Brewing Stand[#](). Additionally, you can use [Reagents](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_reagents) to enhance their effects even further.
Adding a Fermented Spider Eye will change the Effect to **Mining Fatigue** instead.
Adding a Fermented Spider Eye will change the Effect to **Hunger** instead.
Adding a Fermented Spider Eye will change the Effect to **Bad Luck** instead.

As the name implies, the [Potion Workshop's](entry://brewing/potion_workshop)[#]() main focus is the creation of powerful [#](bb00bb)Potions[#]().\
But with the help of all of the filigree and granular adjustable switches and valves you found great utility in it for creating other things, too.\
[#]()All these recipes do not use [Reagents](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_reagents).
The [Lava Sponge](entry://magical_blocks/lava_sponge) will not get used up, allowing you to create large amounts of [#](bb00bb)Lava[#]() quickly.
Will consume 10 XP from the [#](bb00bb)Knowledge Gem[#]().
Will consume 100 XP from the [#](bb00bb)Knowledge Gem[#]().

Using [Mermaid's Gems](entry://general/mermaids_brush)[#]() as a base instead of [#](bb00bb)Blaze Powder[#]() results in a much more reactive potion. Not only does this allow you to add your personal range of additional magical ingredients, but also use some of them as additional Reagent. Each of those Reagents has a unique effect on the [#](bb00bb)Potion[#](). Each Reagent can only be used once per recipe.

The order in which you arrange the reagents does not matter.\
\
**Flat bonuses are applied first, the percentage based ones modify that value after.**

- creates Lingering Potions - also requires Gunpowder as reagent
- Allows you to create Tipped Arrows, if you supply Arrows instead of Bottles
- makes effects not show any particles
- adds a very weird taste and smell to the potion, making it unidentifiable. Also colors it completely black
- converts negative effects to equivalent positive ones
- 75%% chance to add the main effect of the Potion that was brewed before
- adds the main effect of the Potion that was brewed before, but with -25%% potency
- dramatically increases potency at the beginning, but makes potency wear off over time - does not work for instant effects
- negates the duration penalty for Lingering Potions as well as for Tipped Arrows
- large boost to a random stat
- makes the potion much smoother, making it much quicker to drink

- +1 potency for positive effects
- colors the potion in a random color

- +100%% duration
- makes the Potion much slower to drink

- +100%% potency
- makes the Potion much slower to drink
- 10%% chance to add the main effect of the potion that was brewed before with +100%% potency and duration

In the meantime, you have come into possession of many new materials. It's time to take a close look at each of them to see what effect they have on your [#](bb00bb)Potions[#]().\
\
Your educated guess, as an expert: Awesome!

Instead of [#](bb00bb)Blaze Powder[#](), the Potion Workshop runs on [Mermaid's Gems](entry://general/mermaids_brush)[#](). The main advantage is that you don't have to fill your bottles with water before.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.projecti: Each level grants you a small chance to [#](449900)protect you from incoming projectiles[#]().
*If you are wounded, it only makes you more vulnerable. A vicious cycle.*\
\
Prevents you from regenerating health by natural means and prevents you from sprinting.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.swiftnes:
[#](449900)Increases your attack speed[#]() with every level.\
Allows you to repeatedly attack at lightning speed without giving your opponents a chance to attack you.
[#](449900)Decreases your attack speed[#]() with every level instead.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.toughnes:
[#](449900)Weakens powerful attacks[#]() that hit you.\
While great against single, deadly strikes, it does little against lots of small attacks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.brewing.vulnerab: [#](449900)Increases incoming damage[#]() with each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.cr:
It has always been the dream of people to create artificial life.\
\
Since you are now dealing with magical gems yourself, which seem to have magical powers, this should be a piece of cake.

The raw magical powers, which are bundled by the gems, are the best starting point for such research.\
\
Since you seem to be immortal, you have all the time in the world to think about it.\
(last time a green pig walking upright surprised you, you woke up in your bed the next morning)\
\
It's time for... experiments!
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.de:
Your last experiment was not only dangerous, but also quite a pain to get rid of.\
Just in case anything ever gets out of hand you created this modified variant. This time, though, to heal instead of flooding your base.\
\
Yeah, that's probably better.
Gets rid of 99 %% of all self-replicating microorganisms.
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.eg:
Your whole "creating life" thing has yielded mixed results so far. But slowly you feel you are able to move something.\
\
Creating life from nothing is a difficult thing, but combining existing knowledge? You feel a bit like Frankenstein himself.\
*Is that a good thing? Bad? You are not sure at all.*
What would your creation like to eat? It's relevant, for... [reasons](entry://creating_life/memories)[#]().
Able to be [#](449900)sheared[#]() and [#](449900)milked[#](), while also [#](449900)laying eggs[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.fa:
It did not take long before the idea for a construction plan came to you.\
\
The organism you came up with is weak, but it seems that your plans to create new life were successful, at least in principle! Admittedly, it is only a clump of microorganisms, but they are alive!
Every living being has basically the same goals: eat & reproduce.[#]() So... what do these weak creatures eat? Other Blocks? Definitely something easy to digest.

The answer seemed to be organics! Easily digestible indeed.\
When digested by the organism, an interesting by-product was created that you called Vegetal. It consists of the **raw energy of nature**.\
\
You are sure that it will be very useful to you.

Ambition has taken hold of you, seriously. These are your first big leaps towards changing the world.\
Empowered by the potent energy of your [Onyx](entry://general/onyx_shards)[#]() and [Stratine](entry://general/stratine)[#](), this second organism you created is clearly... more active than your last creation.\
\
**And DEFINITELY hungrier.\
WAY hungrier.**
Maybe one of the sturdiest materials you know can satisfy their hunger? What has to be done has to be done.

The Obsidian was literally pulverized. This is what you call power!\
\
The result was this sturdy reagent.\
Very powerful.\
Yes.
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.ha:
The world seems to be far more kind to yourself than anything else around you. When you blacked out after too much damage, you always woke up healthy and fit again, as if you had been given new life.\
In exceptional situations however, you cannot cheat death.\
Alas! You've got something figured out now, should things ever get tough.
To revive a player that died in [#](449900)Hardcore[#](), you will need [#](bb00bb)their personal Player Head[#](), a hefty sum of resources and a bit of time.
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.ki:
Those grand skeletons that dot the depths... even in death, the dragons bear so much might and life to them, there must be some way to recreate their splendor via those [Dragonbone Chunks](entry://general/dragonbone@dragonbone_chunks)[#]().\
\
Maybe you will be the one to restore the age of divine dragons?
*Your own personal fierce dragon. This will be great.*

*So much for your plans for a personal jurassic park. Maybe a petting zoo would be more suitable?*\
\
The result definitely is not quite as... fierce... as you imagined. Usually you'd say you are used to failures by now, but with this result who are you to complain?
Their down looks beyond soft.*Maybe, if you sneak up to one with [Shears](item://minecraft:shears), you are able to snip a feather or two?*
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.me:
With the [Spirit Instiller](entry://creating_life/spirit_instiller), you are able to breathe new life into a once dead creature.\
It will materialise in the form of a *Memory*.

To remember the memories about a creature, you need its [Head](entry://creating_life/mob_heads), as well as its most beloved item and [Vegetal](entry://general/fading@vegetal) as a bonding agent.\
Using [Neolith](entry://general/failing@neolith) seems to completely overpower the energies of the creature, making the resulting Memory unrecognizable, until it manifests.

Memories need a certain amount of time to manifest, almost like an egg: you have to place them down and wait. Depending on the creature, it may be reasonably quick, or take forever.\
\
*Placing them on top of certain blocks seems to speed up that process or stop it entirely.*
With your vast knowledge, you are now even able to resurrect Ender Dragons, Withers and Wardens.
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.mo:
Using your new [Treasure Hunter](entry://enchanting/treasure_hunter) enchantment you are able to collect heads from all kinds of mobs.\
\
While they make for a nice display of your modest acquisitions they still inherit a small spark of that creature's existence.
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.ru:
This is it: the perfection of your recipe. A little failure definitely couldn't stop you.\
This may be the one thing aggressive enough to destroy even some materials previously deemed unbreakable.\
If you are not careful you may ruin the world.\
A necessary sacrifice, really.
You won't even make it subtle. This stuff is [#](ff0000)NASTY[#]() by design, you didn't call it that for the fun of it.
Even Bedrock was not strong enough to withstand your newly created "life".  It broke through the Bedrock like dandelions through concrete.

Should you be reading your notes here while some of that stuff is still roaming around free, you should change that as soon as possible otherwise you MIGHT regret it.\
\
Luckily you already invented a [suitable counteragent](entry://general/decay_away).
The chunks of Bedrock are so sturdy, that a normal Crafting Table can't handle it. But your [Pigment Pedestal](entry://general/pedestal) handles it no problem.

These seem so sturdy, not even a Wither would be able to break them.\
\
Of course you are also able to convert it back again.
book.spectrum.guidebook.creating_life.sp:
The [Resonance](entry://enchanting/resonance) enchantment enables you to get Spawners to drop, to be collected by you.\
\
While you haven't yet figured out how to make these constructs yourself, you now feel more than capable of changing their properties in your favor, using the [Spirit Instiller](entry://creating_life/spirit_instiller).
Using a similar technique to [remembering Memories](entry://creating_life/memories) you can change the Spawners creature association, making it spew out another type of creature altogether.
Lowers both min and max spawn delay.
Increases the count of Creatures summoned with each cycle.

Increases the number of creatures allowed to be close to the spawner.\
*Spawners seem to naturally stop spawning creatures when there are a lot of them close-by already. Almost like they want to give you a chance. Pathetic, isn't it? As if you would need that.*
Increases the range you can stand for the spawner to still spawn creatures.

With all the knowledge you have gathered, you have created the Spirit Instiller. It seems to be able to connect the energies of two items, with the help of a third object to bind them.\
\
An almost spiritual process.
The Spirit Instiller needs a focus structure to work. To rotate the structure hologram in the direction you want, click on the placed Spirit Instiller itself.

Dimensions: 8x9x5 blocks\
It can be enhanced by placing [Upgrades](entry://magical_blocks/upgrades)[#]() on the two [#](bb00bb)Onyx Chiseled Blocks[#]().

- 1 Spirit Instiller
- 2 Item Bowls
- 2 Notched Polished Blocks
- 2 Chiseled Polished Blocks
- 2 Onyx Chiseled Blocks
- 6 Polished Pillars
- 17 Polished Slabs
- 41 Polished Blocks
- 2 Gemstone Chimes
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.name: Painter's Cuisine
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.aloe.pag: These drought-loving plants are able to grow almost everywhere. Ironically, as sturdy as they are, they can not handle too much light and nutrient-rich soil. Down here, there was simply no reason to adapt to that, you guess.

You can break off individual leaves. They retain a lot of moisture and are quite nutritious.\
Planted, they will grow into a full-fledged new plant over time.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.amaranth: Though seemingly left behind for quite some time now, these seeds still look very much alive. You wonder what comes out of it when grown?

You never have seen anything like it. Such an intense red. So expressive!\
These Bushels can be crushed to get more grains.\
\
They can also be planted decoratively on grass or in a flower pot.
The taste of Amaranth is as different from Wheat as its appearance. In your mind sprouted completely new ideas, like this deliciousness here.

Small but fine pastry filled with cream.\
\
*Perfect with tea.*

This feast is guaranteed to fill your belly for quite some time.\
\
*Full of fat and meat and wine and warp!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.blood_or:
Extracts of the [Blood Orchid](entry://general/blood_orchids) have an intense effect when consumed: they may put you in a [#](449900)Frenzy[#]().\
Damage, attack speed, movement speed and knockback resistance are buffed with each kill. The higher the effect's level, the higher the buff. Not scoring a kill in 10 seconds will debuff you instead.

Instead of resetting the duration, applying another [#](449900)Frenzy[#]() effect will increase its potency instead.\
\
In order to get the most out of the effect, apply one with a long duration first, then stack up with shorter effects.
A Petal's active ingredient can be extracted into a thick solution. Almost smells like rose water, but its effect is definitely... *a little more effervescent*.
The [#](449900)Frenzy[#]() effect you may get starts out low, but lasts a bit longer.
The [#](449900)Frenzy[#]() effect you may get is relatively short, but starts out quite potent.
A truly nasty brew. Tastes exactly like what you would expect.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.brewers_: Brewers Handbook
Brewing for the Deep
*Reflection Of The Moon*

Hayo! The current state of relations between the overworld and the deep is rather poor, and unfortunately it seems to only be getting worse, and to that end I sadly can't do much.\
\
As such, I have taken some of my time to collect a bunch of brewing recipes from the surface, adapt them to use ingredients found in the depths, and publish that as a gift to you all, in hopes that it will aid you.
Pink Cups

\
Heya, glass peaches are not just for imperators!\
\
We can enjoy them too! This brief and easy to follow recipe makes for a nice, creamy cup of peachy goodness - if you have any, and I understand why you wouldn't, sweet berries make for a great garnish!
*Do not swap the berries out for holly ones, they are no good...*
Holly Hot Drinks

\
Those thickets of pyrite... they are I think my favorite places in the depths, there is something just so pretty about them, even accounting for how dangerous just existing in them is.\
\
Regardless! While the berries of the bushes that grow there are poisonous, we can side step that...
*But if you do want to use those holly berries for something, here you go.*
Not Honey Wine

\
This not mead, you could not legally call it mead, I am obligated to clarify it is not mead.\
\
\
 So this mead is a bit of a favorite recipe of mine, it took a while to figure out how to adapt honey wine for a place that has no bees, but trust me, this genuinely outdoes the real deal.
*Not a mead, no no no.*
*Not a mead, no no no.*
Heat for the Heart

\
Myceylon, that odd cinnamon-esque spice you all have down there. I am honestly really fond of the stuff, it reminds me of those long, tender nights I used to spend down there. Though like most, I associate the spice with a level of warmth and comfort, for me there is this undertone of longing...

*Burns on the way down and when it gets there too.\
\
 Great if you have someone you want to get hot and bothered.*
[Hidden Page 1]

\
Hi. I'm sorry I did not get more to you all, this is all I could manage to sneak in - anything passing by the mouth of the caves is closely monitored, and I myself can feel the gaze of the surface imperators scorching my back. I really, really wanted to do more, but the fact that I need to use a pseudonym should reveal the state of my condition. This is all I can do. I hope it will be enough.
*This took a lot out of me to get working. Through this, you should be able to use blood orchid extract more aggressively. If worse comes to worst, it should give you an edge.*
[Hidden Page 2]

...Asteras\
\
I hope that this message will reach you. The state of things has only worsened since we last spoke, the nobles are still targeting you, but more worryingly.... They are preparing for war, it is clear by now. They want the bloomstone, and they are willing to sacrifice a lot for it. Things are going to get bad, please stay safe.\
*        ... I miss you.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.enchante: Almost as tough as your life.
As you can clearly see, the effect is conceivably weaker than the one of [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Golden Apples[#](), but they still make a handy crunchy snack for short trips.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.fishes.p:
Well, not actually a fish, but a *crustacean*.\
\
They seem to thrive even in the [muddiest of ponds](entry://magical_blocks/mud).
A pale, large and indolent fish which feels most at home in puddles of [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal).
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.freigeis:
As the first drop touched your lips, it already filled your body with immense might. Just the memory of it makes your hand *tremble* of tension. That's no good.\
And yet you have never felt more powerful and alive than you did at this very moment.\
However, is it really worth emptying that vial? Should you die against all odds, the price will be immense.

\
*Caress the one,\
 the never-fading\
Rain in your heart,\
 the tears of\
 snow-white sorrow\
Caress the one,\
 the hiding amaranth\
In a land of the daybreak*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.glisteri:
The [Jade Vine](entry://general/jade_vines)[#]() is known for its regenerative properties, similar to [#](bb00bb)Glistering Melons[#](). As it happens, mixing them together reveals an exquisitely harmonious, sweet taste.\
\
Temporarily grants you a small health boost.
*Don't even think about drinking that with milk!*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.imbrifer:
Welcome. Lets not get caught up with introductions - you're here because you want to learn how to cook, I can teach you. I studied in the Meriloux Culinary College, the finest culinary institution in the deep; I trained under the mentorship of Imperial Chef Aeverstrone, catering for the [#](ff3d71)scarlet moon bloodline[#](); I, with a team of my own apprentices, brought Imbrifer its first full-lotus restaurant. \
\
*Follow my lead and I'll teach you true taste.*

\
Everybody has to start somewhere, and for my students, this is that somewhere. Crawfish Cocktails are deceiving, they seem simple, but to truly master them takes finesse and practice. It is possible to flambé the peaches and spices to make a sweet, syrupy, spicy sauce without cooking the crawfish, but it demands an immense amount of care. I use this to filter new students.

*It can take hundreds of tries to get it right the first time.\
\
Many will crack before that.*

\
Bagnun is a culinary school classic. A heavily spiced, luxurious soup cut by a dollop of fresh cream; the contrast of scarlet, peppery soup and refreshing pearly cream makes a feast for the eyes and tongue alike. There was a woman I used to know of melochites. She loved a soup not too dissimilar to this one. We used to be good friends long ago, she called me egocentric.

\
The various plants of the Jade genus are generally desirable.\
\
Their bulbs in particular are highly sought after, being alike onions in texture, but more delicate, sweet and ethereal in taste, earning them the moniker of truffles of the deep. This recipe makes use of a modern crossbreed of two native species - the striking [Jade Vine](entry://general/jade_vines)[#]().

*I've heard Jade Vine nectar has restorative properties...\
\
what a curious crossbreed.*

\
If anyone tells you that you need to cook fishcake, they're not just wrong, but also stupid. The proper way to prepare fishcake is to first spice and paste your fish, then let it ferment in a bath of nephrite vinegar for at least 72 hours. This will not just kill any parasites in the fish, but also cure the cake, giving it its signature pink color.
*The finest fishcake cures for months, if not years.*

\
I am not a brewer, and thus I cannot give much past the ingredients for Aqua Regia.\
\
But I can note that, for the good chef, it is essential to understand your ingredients and how they are made. You cannot judge quality if you do not know how quality is created.
*Know your ingredients, learn them, understand them.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.imperial:
*Chef Aeverstrone of the\
     Scarlet Moon Court*

Hello young one! I hope you've come to share in this little old man's love for cooking.\
\
To introduce myself, I am Aeverstrone of Kurivinda, and I have served the [#](ff3d71)scarlet moon court[#]() for the last 80 years, serving as head imperial chef, though nowadays I mostly personally cook for the imperial family. Do forgive me if I digress a bit throughout this book, having been around for over 170 years gives you a lot to reminisce over!

\
Imperators and peaches, they are practically inseparable! Those nephrite trees that grow in these regions did not originate here, rather, they are endemic to a land far beyond this one, deep to the east. The love my imperators have for glass peaches is so great that they've brought them everywhere they've gone - You could map out where they've reigned just by following the nephrite blossoms!
*The Shura have gold, graceless humans have purple, but for us? The color of royalty is pink! Hahahah!*

\
This dish of lizard meat braised in wine and petals is a delicacy, and one that I would not blame you for messing up the first 2 or 20 times you cook it. To this day this stands to be one of the hardest dishes I cook regularly, it is a protracted process that deals with a lot of delicate ingredients. But the result is something truly wonderful.
*Honestly, I never remember how to spell its name.*

\
The humble Junket, variants of this sweet, glutinous snack exist in all forms, though this one is a particularly eccentric one! I honestly do not enjoy preparing these very much, extracting the oils from the petals is a long and tedious process, but the children of the court always get so excited when they see the stuff - it makes my old heart swell.

*Imperator Aava loved this when he was a wee kitten.\
\
I'm pretty sure the goober still does.*

\
I have a fun story tied to this recipe. Koi, in addition to being gorgeous creatures, make for the basis of some of the most unique and stunning imperial recipes. These recipes however often require odd and exotic ingredients, and one day we were clean out the night before a banquet. Thinking swiftly, I swapped out the ferment for [mother of moor](entry://general/fading)[#](), resulting in this flower-like dish.
*Don't let this ferment for too long or the mother is going to start eating away at the fish!*

\
Ah, wine, what a diverse and vibrant world. This recipe predates me - I know, it may surprise you to hear that there are things older than me, heh - it's a sort of desert wine, popular in my court and used in many recipes you may have seen.\
\
I'll tell you, go easy on it, this stuff hits a lot harder than you'd expect.
*Reminiscent of mead, but closer to an alcoholic nectar.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.infused_:
Fermentation is a very natural process - things take time and care. Since there never is a fully controlled environment there are a lot of variables.\
You can follow the recipe to the point, or play around. Fermentation is Art!

- Time: It takes time for the barrel to influence the contents. Most beverages get more intense and even additional effects, when given more time than strictly required
- Temperature: The hotter it is, the more of your precious content simply evaporates over time. This is called the Angel's Share

- Humidity: The more humid the air, the more water evaporates in comparison to alcohol, making the drink stronger
- Water Share: An increased rate of ingredients to water is a fine balance, but one to be played with. More thickness makes the drink ferment faster, albeit at the cost of shorter status effect durations
Malt beer is filling and tastes both sweet and savory. What a nice combination.

The [#](bb00bb)Titration Barrel[#]() is capable of brewing alcoholic drinks. If you are old enough to consume alcohol in your country, you can press the button below to unlock these recipes.\
If not don't worry - you won't miss anything important.
In addition to Haste it can grant a bit of Saturation, depending on how long it fermented.
Just... don't brew them too long or they will shift and end up tasting awful.
Just... don't brew them too long or they will shift and end up tasting awful.
A strong taste, made even more intense via the influence of the colored wood, grants [#](449900)Absorption[#]() and [#](449900)Resistance[#]().
The large amount of sugar in honey is perfect for fermentation. The result is a strong, although still sweet drink.
Fermented apples, usually sweet and sparkly, with a slight note of sour - if you do not forget to tap it soon enough.
Way more potent than their common counterpart. Won't go bad over time and taste glorious for sure.
A much more fruity cider than from apples. The glowy variant seems to ferment a bit quicker, but also... makes you glow. Hmm.
Berries can also be used for liquor. Way more viscous, sweet and strong, but takes longer to ferment.
Only gets stronger with age. Just one question: How deadly do you want it?
Does only get stronger with age. Tastes like a bar fight.

Lies wonderfully light in the mouth. A gentle, sweetish burn, which lets you forget your worries for a bit. The things that worry you will forget you for a bit, too[#]().\
\
*Tastes like walking on the moon.*
An interesting combination of all things Deeper Down. Best drunk when still hot!

Your memory isn't always up to snuff. Somehow you ended up with this bottle. Definitely got a little stronger than planned...\
More to disinfect than to drink.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.jade_win:
Since the [Jade Vines](entry://general/jade_vines)[#]() are notorious for restorative properties, it's no wonder they translate perfectly when fermented.\
In contrast to the slight bitterness of the bulbs, adding a good share of petals brings out a more bloomy and slightly sour taste instead, complimented with earthy undertones - almost resembling wine, in trademark jade color.

[#](bb00bb)1 Bulb[#]() and [#](bb00bb)3 Petals[#]() for the [#](bb00bb)Bucket of Water[#]() feel like a good starting point.\
The longer the fermentation goes on, the stronger the taste gets. \
\
*A bit of [#](bb00bb)added sweetness[#]()* would do it good, you are sure.
Adding a drop of [#](bb00bb)Moonstruck Nectar[#]() seems to make the Wine much easier to drink. The fermentation process is increased and negative effects are noticeably softened.

Your newest result of fermenting Jade Wine was a *tad* too long.\
Immensely bitter and slightly acidic taste.\
While it retains some of the properties of the Jade Wine it once resembled, seems more useful for medicine than for drinking.\
But, you know... is anyone stopping you?
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.lucky_ro:
Are you going to become a pastry chef after all, in addition to your main job as an artist? These don't even look that bad (taste good too!).\
\
Composed of [Amaranth](entry://cuisine/amaranth), [#](bb00bb)Sugar[#](), [#](bb00bb)Milk[#](), and a [Four-Leafed Clover](entry://general/clover)[#](), it has a very special effect: you noticed that you were a little bit more successful handling tools with Fortune, Looting and other random-based things.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.melochit: Melochites Cookbook Vol. 1
Melochites Cuisine
*Aunt Melaya*

Hoi nephews! Whether this is your first time reading perusing a cookbook, or you are a seasoned cook that has been following my tattling a while, I hope you are ready to explore some wonderful recipes with your aunt Malaya. Together we will delve into some gorgeous traditional recipes from my corner of the deep that I hope you will love~!\
\
  *~Mehrunes Chellaya of Melochites*
A Sweet, Woody Stew

\
Hearty, filling, and invigorating - Banyash may very well be the backbone of Melochites! \
\
 This simple dish of crawfish is a bit of a favorite of mine, though the recent state of the surface has made access to sweet berries somewhat difficult. Nonetheless, it remains the choice of malachite miners for good reason!
*A sweet and savory Banyash, with notes of the woods. made with crawfish and love~*
Hearty Roast with Beer

\
Young hare is a delicacy not just here in Melochites, but in almost any place where Dreitons roam. If you get the chance, please, *please* try using an artisanal azurte stout in this recipe, that kind of beer is only made in a sparse few areas of Melochites but trust me, hard as it may be to get, it is life changing with rabbit.
*While a malt beer is traditional, any good, artisanal brew will do*
Loaf for a Family

\
Feeding an entire group of people is no easy feat, but it is something that any mother has had to deal with on the regular, I can tell you that much myself. This recipe for meatloaf has been passed down, doe to kit, in my family for generations - just thinking about how my mom used to cook it makes me tear up a bit... I hope that you will pass it down onto your own kids.

*A lovely way to feed your own nieces and nephews... \
\
 you are planning to feed a family right?*
Stuffing Buns with Meat

*Much more suitable for a single person.\
\
 Though admittedly, it is still too big to fit in me.*
Fermented Fish
*For the really freaky among you. Really takes your breath away.*
Melochites Cookbook Vol. 2
Melochites Desserts
*Aunt Melaya*

Hoi nephews! Whether this is your first time reading perusing a cookbook, or you are a seasoned cook that has been following my tattling a while, I hope you are ready to explore some wonderful recipes with your aunt Malaya. Together we will explore some wondrous dessert and drink recipes from my home region, which I hope you'll enjoy~! \
\
 * ~Mehrunes Chellaya of Melochites*
Creamy Shots

\
While Melochites may be best known for the amount and quality of malachite it exports, I can tell you there is much more to this lovely place I call home. The breweries and distilleries nestled in this corner of the caves are nothing short of wonderful, and the lovely liquors they make have resulted in the creation of a lot of cocktails and drinks!
*Leaves you feeling cozy inside*
Plump and Chocolatey

\
Oh, graces, of all the wonders of the surface, I can tell you none compare to the delightful cacao and chocolate. \
\
 If there were one thing that could compel me to permanently move out and up, it would be those two, they are truly wonderful, and if you disagree with me, I assure you this recipe will make change your mind.
*If there is any proof that the Shura are still watching over us and life is good, this is it.*
A Dessert Tart

\
You know, sometimes it is easy to get caught up in the details of things, in nuance and long recipe lists. \
Sometimes, simpler is better,and this lovely pastry is a prime example of that; milk, flour, butter, and sugar, that is all you need - don't let those stuck up Imbrifer gourmets tell you tell you otherwise!

*Sweet, crispy and delicate. \
\
Goes great with tea!*
Stuffed Treat!

\
A lot of people would say that us of Melochites are mighty eaters, and admittedly we do tend to be a bit plump. \
\
But, be honest nephew, if you lived in a place with a culinary tradition as rich as what I've shown you, wouldn't you get a bit peckish too? At any rate, I think a lot of you lovely readers appreciate my plumpness...
*A pound of eggs, a pound of sugar, a pound of flour, and a pound of cream.*
Sugar Rush

\
Believe me or not, Glass peaches are not only good with hearty food, but are also suitable for desserts. Try it out! With even more sugar than these parts already have preserved in the jar, this jam gives you a proper kick and whistles vigorously through your arteries.
*So sweet it will color your blood orange.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.myceylon:
Using an [#](bb00bb)Axe[#]() or [Multitool](entry://equipment/tools_and_armor/multitool)[#]() you could strip small, but unexpectedly sturdy pieces off the [Noxshrooms](entry://dimension/noxshroom_forest)[#](). Those were both unexpectedly sturdy for a mushroom and... tasty.\
\
Myceylon adds great flavor to baked goods and [drinks](entry://cuisine/infused_beverages)[#]().
This beverage, brewed from [#](bb00bb)Chorus Fruit[#](), inherits - and amplifies - not only the special taste, but also the unique property of the plant.\
\
When ingested, this drink randomly teleports you over great distances. The higher the alcohol content, the further.
*Tastes like raspberry, but there are none in it at all. Strange.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.restorat:
Is there anything cozier than sitting by your homemade fireplace on a rainy evening, sipping a cup of tea?\
Surely: killing a boss beforehand.\
\
This tea, brewed from the petals of [Jade Vines](entry://general/jade_vines) is good for both relaxing and protecting you from the deadly effect of the Wither. *Convenient*.
*Don't even think about drinking that with [#](bb00bb)Milk[#]()!
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.rock_can:
A stick with [#](bb00bb)Sugar[#]() on it.\
\
...wait wait wait, there's more to it!\
If you place this stick so that its underside is immersed in [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal), you just have to slowly dissolve more Sugar in the liquid until the stick turns into a sweet-crunchy candy stick.
You might even be able to add more stuff than just plain Sugar when immersed? Liquid *Crystal* and all that...
[#](449900)Silk Touch[#]() keeps their size for use as fancy lights, or just for storage.

Dissolving [Gemstone Powder](entry://general/gemstone_powder) instead of Sugar in the liquid allowed the Rock Candy to take on the gemstone's typical color.\
\
You always wanted to know what those taste like. Definitely seems like a healthier option than snorting them up your nose.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.sawblade:
These berries remind you of [#](bb00bb)Sweetberries[#](). In contrast to those, however, these are rather dry.\
Can be eaten, but have an unpleasant consistency. Better than nothing, should things get tough.

Harvested by shearing a Sawblade Holly Bush. Can be used as a [Potion Reagent](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_reagents@prickly_bayleaf)[#]() and in cooking.\
\
*Clearly easier to digest cooked than raw...*
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.star_can:
It seems those [Shooting Stars](entry://general/stargazing) have more secrets than you previously thought, and weird ones at that.\
Baked [Stardust](entry://general/stargazing@stardust)[#]() tastes oddly refreshing, the magic makes your tongue tingle as the heaven-sent candy dissolves in your mouth. You felt strangely healthier afterwards.\
Their hard, golden flesh has some purple speckles, shimmering like star shards.
Perhaps the speckles are the source of their restorative properties? You are left to wonder if it is possible to create a fully purple one.

Now THAT's a tasty one!\
Even just touching those star-laden streaks gives you much the same tingle as when you ate the whole thing.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.suspicio:
Curiously, the combination of mushrooms and water is a perfect receptor for all forms of other bloomy notes, either rounding the taste, or creating... very peculiar ones.\
\
Each flower has a specific effect, as if you would feed it to a [#](449900)Brown Mooshroom[#]().
The fermentation process in colored wood makes the effect last quite a bit longer than [#](bb00bb)Suspicious Stew[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.tarts.pa:
Even though you are not the most proficient chef, even this rudimentary one tastes great! \
\
You can garnish it with different toppings to grant you [#](449900)defensive abilities[#]() for a short duration.
The classic. The only thing that would make this one more delicious would be the tears of your enemies.

Makes you able to see & swim in Lava as if it were Water.\
However, does NOT make you fire immune.
Makes you able to swim at light speed and greatly increases your underwater mining rate.
Makes you feel well rested, like after a good night's sleep. Scares away creatures of nightmares.
Small chance for projectiles to simply deflect off of you.
book.spectrum.guidebook.cuisine.titratio:
The idea of fermenting [food](entry://cuisine/titration_barrel@kimchi) and [drinks](entry://cuisine/infused_beverages) in [Colored Wood](entry://general/colored_trees@colored_wood) was not far away. Over time, the properties of the wood influence its contents.\
The results are sometimes more and sometimes less delicious (although the latter could be due to your cooking skills), but always interesting.\
Holds up to a stack of items and 1 bucket of liquid.
*When you blink and it felt like the world stopped existing? Each time that happens, the barrel fermentation process seems to have advanced.*
Fermentation is not for drinks alone! Made from 3 different vegetables, Kimchi is a hearty dish, best served as a side.
Takes a short while, but more efficient than just slapping the ingredients together.
Slightly fermented, it still keeps the properties of [#](bb00bb)Milk[#](). Eating will remove currently active Status Effects.

A great snack. Biting off a piece is quick and even makes you reasonably full.\
Pleasantly sweet and fruity.
An elaborate feast of flavor that is guaranteed to make your mouth water.
Perfect for relaxing, and refreshing in the cold season.
Sweet delicacies, guaranteed to give you more than a sugar rush - depending on the toppings.\
Made from [Jaramel](entry://general/jade_vines@jaramel), [#](449900)Gelatin[#]() & [Amaranth](entry://cuisine/amaranth).\
Even the simple one tastes great!
The classic. The only thing that would make this one more delicious would be the tears of your enemies.
Gives out effects at random. Fancy a gamble?
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.name: Decoration
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.banne: Resources and tools you come across can be used directly in the Loom as patterns.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.block:
Remember the blocks that shielded your precious gemstones from external influences? \
\
Maybe they also absorbed some of the magical properties of the geodes themselves?\
Who knows.
The bright white of Calcite may be the brightest natural color you've stumbled across - very clean looking and radiating dignity. A wonderful contrast to the dark hues of Basalt.

Applying heat emphasizes their dark and white textures even more.\
When smelted, the Basalt turns nearly black. They can be crafted into a wide array of decoration blocks in the [#](bb00bb)Crafting Table[#]() or [#](bb00bb)Stone Cutter[#]().
You can crack Bricks & Tiles via [Item Crushing](entry://general/item_crushing)[#]().
By applying heat, all blocks can be converted back to their polished variant again.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.color: You've finally managed to mix colors properly. What could be more natural than to try out the properties of your new [Pigments](entry://general/pigment)[#]() right away? You've had enough of the normal [#](bb00bb)Redstone Lamps[#]() by now. Time to add a splash of color![#]()
They are surrounded by a vibrant light when activated. Besides that, Colored Lamps function similar to their boring Redstone counterpart.

As you wandered through a leafy cave, you noticed the many petals sailing through the air.\
\
You were so enchanted by this sight that you set out to design your own, colorful variations.
By using different pigment you can color the petals in a wide variety of colors.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.decos:
These two-block high decorative stones are a representation of your precious find.\
\
They make quite an imposing impression.
Decostones come in all gemstone colors available to you.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.efful:
You really have to envy the [Kindlings](entry://general/kindlings)[#](), spending their days covered in these fluffy, poofy things. Beyond soft - luxurious both in feel and color, even with the [#](f0af15)golden liveliness[#]() that flows through them.\
You could see yourself falling asleep on a cushion made from these.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.ether:
In your search for a block that is passable for you but doesn't destroy the look of your buildings, [Shooting Stars](entry://general/stargazing)[#]() were a great help.\
\
With the intensifying power of [Onyx](entry://general/onyx_shards)[#](), you were able to strengthen the particles to such an extent that they became solid.
Another practical feature of Ethereal Platforms is that the platform reacts only to living creatures. Objects, such as items, simply pass through it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.gemst:
Having dealt with the gems long enough, you now find yourself able to shape these fragile resources in the finest of ways.\
\
Slowly swaying in the wind, the chimes sounds remind you of the beginning of your journey - the first time you set foot in a geode.
Each chime emits the soothing sound of its corresponding gemstone.
Your gemstones are already slightly transparent by nature. What could be more natural than to form a kind of glass from these materials?[#]()
Gemstone Glass comes in all the colors of gemstones available to you.
When you set foot in the first geode, you were met with a pleasant cozy glow. With your knowledge and the help of Shimmerstone, it is easy to amplify this light to create fancy lamps.[#]()

Gemstone Lamps come in all the colors of gemstones available to you. Both [Chiseled Calcite](entry://decoration/block_variants@chiseled_and_notched)[#]() and [Chiseled Basalt](entry://decoration/block_variants@chiseled_and_notched)[#]() can be used as a base.

[#](bb00bb)Calcite[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Basalt[#]() keep the energies of the gems in check as long as they completely enclose the geode, that much is certain. Sometimes, however, the energy accumulated over centuries is so strong that it tears a hole in the geode.\
\
You recreated the whole thing in miniature.[#]()
Come in all gemstone colors. The frame can be built out of [Polished Basalt](entry://decoration/block_variants@polishing)[#]() or [Polished Calcite](entry://decoration/block_variants@polishing)[#]().
If you manage to obtain complete gemstone clusters, the runes are much more efficient to create.

The gems have an exceptionally beautiful appearance.\
The look of the raw gems, as you know them from the geodes, seems a little too natural for your edgier buildings. With enough resources, however, this should not be a problem.\
\
And if you run out of gems at some point, the decoration can easily be broken up again.[#]()
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.glowb:
You have color as pure as can be. So why not create blocks with color as pure as can be!\
\
You thought about calling them [#](449900)Antiblocks[#](), but since they are indeed blocks that would be silly, right?
Glowblocks come in all colors and always look the same, no matter how much light falls on their surface.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.item_:
There's always something you forget when leaving the base - maybe placing it in this decorative Item Bowl will serve as a good reminder.[#]()\
\
It comes in both a [#](bb00bb)Basalt[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Calcite[#]() variant.

The Item Bowl presents a single item stack floating above it.\
Click an item into the Bowl or throw it on top to put it in.

You immediately took a liking to the rotating roundels in those ancient structures, so much so that you copied their design yourself. Definitely a nice way to present your items, or keep them ready.\
\
*Hopefully the patents have already expired.*
The basalt and calcite varieties you cobbled together hold significantly more items, up to 6 whole stacks.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.parti:
The [Shooting Star](entry://general/stargazing)[#]() you picked up left a fantastic shower of particles on their way to the ground. You created the Particle Spawner to replicate this spectacle - and lots of others - yourself.[#]()\
\
A chimney? Rocket launching particles? Atmospheric particle rain for your Pedestal? The Particle Spawner has you covered.
Use the GUI to configure the particles to your liking. Apply a [#](449900)redstone signal[#]() to start the fantastic display. You will unlock more particles as you progress.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.phant:
You would like to display your most precious belongings. So far, you've always used item frames for that. But some of your exhibitions would look better if you didn't see the frame.\
Piece of cake, you just take advantage of the light manipulating properties of your gems.
The Phantom Frame becomes invisible as soon as you display an item in it.
This one has another nice touch: the presented item in it shines in a bright light, making it look even more imposing.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.radia:
You need a way to efficiently light your shelter and other structures.\
\
What could be better than using the luminous properties of [Shimmerstone](entry://general/shimmerstone)[#]() directly in your glass?[#]()
Radiant Glass is pretty much the opposite of Tinted Glass. The [Shimmerstone](entry://general/shimmerstone)[#]() used in its manufacture ensures that the glass glows from within.
book.spectrum.guidebook.decoration.shimm:
On your first nights in this new world, you lit your improvised hut with torches. As atmospheric as that was, it was also primitive.\
To move away from your dark, torch-lit past, you created lamps based on Shimmerstone.
There are various variants, depending on what polished block you use as a base.
Blackslag can be used, too, resulting in an especially dark variant.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.name: Beneath the Bedrock
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.black_:
What must have happened here to turn whole swaths of land into this dead wasteland? Some terrible accident, for sure. Whatever - or whoever - was responsible for this might have had a similar experience to yours.... only much more tragic.\
\
The *things* growing here - calling them plants would be an outrage even to [#](bb00bb)Dead Bushes[#]() - look anything but healthy.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.blacks: A common, darkish and sturdy stone that constitutes a large part of the lower levels of the Deeper Down.
The [#](bb00bb)Blast Furnace[#]() smelts these stones even faster than a [#](bb00bb)Furnace[#]().
By applying heat, all blocks can be converted back to their polished variant again.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.crysta: Lakes of [Liquid Crystal](entry://general/liquid_crystal)[#]() and giant [crystalline structures](entry://dimension/hummingstone)[#]() define its look.

The ground is covered with a small layer of soil. Not much, but more than enough to be covered with a thick carpet of moss. The many natural light sources in this biome allow plants to grow here that you might find on the surface, unlike most other biomes.

Little trees, as big as they get down here - more like a big bush. ...or giant shrub.\
Eeeeh, details.\
\
Their fruit isn't made of glass, but it shimmers very much as if it is. They are very tasty too.\
Eating one may give you a short burst of [#](449900)Toughness[#](), which reduces the damage you take from hard attacks. They can also be [fermented](entry://cuisine/infused_beverages)[#]() and [used to brew potions](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_brewing)[#]().

Imposing vines are hanging from the high ceiling and break through the darkness with their light. They are very tasty and can be used as a [Potion Reagent](entry://brewing/potion_workshop_reagents)[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.deep_b:
At first glance, there's not much to see here, and yet it's worth a visit: ores smile at you from every corner - as far as you can see (which isn't far, to be honest).\
\
In some places, gigantic veins of ore crisscross this biome. A single vein will last you years.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.deep_d:
These caves must have existed since time began.\
You wonder how big the gigantic stalactites here can get. You've seen ones that span hundreds of blocks already.\
The ground is speckled in puddles of [#](bb00bb)Water[#]().
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.doombl: This plant has a rather... unusual way to dispense its seed and scare away predators: Its blossom houses a capsule of explosive gas that pops, when disturbed. When not being cautious around this flower, such as touching it a bit too harshly, you risk converting your surroundings into a burning crater.
When fully grown, you can harvest [#](bb00bb)Gunpowder[#]() from it. Breaking it without blowing it up requires a Silk Touch tool or Shears.

Much more aggressive than common [#](bb00bb)Fire[#]() started by [#](bb00bb)Flint & Steel[#](), the [#](bb00bb)Primordial Fire[#]() started by Doomblooms seems to burn with an insatiable, blazing heat. almost as consuming matter and souls alike.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.downst:
At the deepest parts of the Deeper Down, this stone was waiting for you.\
Immensely hard, even Bedrock is a laugh compared to it.

Looks like whoever came before you was able to harvest Downstone! But only with the help of colossal, imposing drills.\
\
It seems like they used it to manufacture [#](bb00bb)Preservation Stone[#]()?
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.dragon:
Is it really dragons these giant remains come from?\
You don't know, honestly. But judging by the size, it could very well be!\
\
Even now, these blocks are surrounded by a magical aura, protecting it from blatant destruction. Still, you had a blast just running your fingers over their rough surface.

Damaging Dragonbone using [#](449900)Explosions[#]() seems to breeze away most of the magical protective aura, finally making it mineable.\
The dropped pieces still retained some of that ancient, magical aura.
The [Cinderhearth](entry://ink/cinderhearth)[#]() is the only thing that generates enough heat to turn these bones into ash.
Most blocks can be converted back to their polished variant again via the [Cinderhearth](entry://ink/cinderhearth)[#]().
These undemanding plants are able to grow virtually everywhere, even on hard stone.
Bonemeal makes them grow and spread.

Lakes of [Dragonrot](entry://dimension/dragonrot) pervade the swamp-like thicket here.\
An acidic smell lingers in the air.
These small plants spread over the ground like ivy. In small clusters they grow in a clump of snapping green. When you fertilize them, they spread even further.
It's not dirt, it's not mud, it's... something - you don't know what. In any case, you sink in a little when you step on it..

It looks red-hot, as if it were on fire, burning like hell to the touch (you *had* to satisfy your curiosity...) and yet radiates no heat at all.\
While [Midnight Solution](entry://general/midnight_solution)[#]() seems to be destructive for the sake of change, Dragonrot seems intent only on pure and total destruction. Certainly there is not much organic that can withstand its bloodlust.
Throwing in some items seems to corrupt them up to a point they turn into something else entirely.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.eraser:
Tiny, hard-to-hit, pack-hunting spiders that inflict a variety of nasty effects when hit.\
\
Those darn critters are a real pest down here. You wouldn't be surprised if THESE were responsible for the downfall of civilizations.\
\
Your usual approach with sword or bow doesn't help much against them, they are too fast for that. Something that does area damage is more likely to.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.delvin:
You wouldn't have thought it possible. As you burst deeper and deeper down through the bedrock, a pitch-black portal opened up. Where does it lead? Only one way to find out.\
*Still, you can't get rid of the lump in your throat...*

A place which has not seen a single ray of sunlight for eons. A place where the sun never shines, shrouded in darkness.\
\
What is waiting for you to discover down there?
There is something lurking for you in the dark, you are sure. Or is it just your nerves?
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.hummin: This very sturdy, very blast resistant glass is scattered all around the [Crystal Gardens](entry://dimension/crystal_gardens).
Between this glass you find these pretty stones that emit a pleasant hum when triggered. You fittingly called those *Hummingstones*.
Only the Cinderhearth develops enough heat to shape the stone. This makes it almost transparent.

It turns out that the pretty sounds of the Hummingstones can build each other up until they shatter in one final anthem.\
The shattered remains never seem to stop vibrating, as if they retain some form of inherent energy.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.lizard:
Quarrelsome beasts that are always looking for trouble.\
\
Actually, they would be kind of cute if they didn't always try to bite off your limbs right away.\
...maybe you'd better keep them behind a [#](bb00bb)Glass Pane[#]() - your extremities will thank you for it.
Not particularly tasty and quite chewy, but it gets the job done.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.noxshr: A [weird mix between Tree and Mushroom](entry://dimension/noxwood) is towering over this biome.
Blackslag, overgrown with a thin layer of a mycelium-like fungi.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.noxwoo:
A mushroom / tree (?) found all across the [Noxshroom Forest](entry://dimension/noxshroom_forest).\
They come in different colors.\
\
The trunks are as firm as wood, while the caps are almost soft and squishy. The bioluminescent gills give off a pleasant glow, which qualifies them as excellent light sources.
So good, every bite makes you twinkle with joy.
Can be placed standing or hanging. [#](449900)Sneak[#]() to place an alternative variant.
Kind of similar to [#](bb00bb)Barrels[#](), but with double the storage space.
Lights up when powered by Redstone.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.preser: *True engineering excellence. But boy does it hurt.*

High-tech machines, crafted from a reinforced shell of basalt and calcite, powered by an unknown energy source that gently pulsates in the center of these contraptions.\
\
Ready to poke holes in you any time you make your presence known.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.pyrite: Hard, sharp and yet surprisingly brittle. These stones are found everywhere in [Razor Edge](entry://dimension/razor_edge).
Unless [#](449900)silk touched[#](), Pyrite shatters into items, requiring you to combine them again.
You can form Pyrite into many decorational blocks via [#](bb00bb)Crafting[#]() or using the [#](bb00bb)Stonecutter[#]().

*Those sharp things are tearing you apart.*\
\
Well, your clothes, for the most part. But still, point stands.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.razor_: Everything here seems to thrive on stabbing you. Not the most welcoming place to be.
Even the ground: Parched and razor sharp due to lack of light and water - hence the name.
Little mean plants that sting immensely when you make contact with them.
book.spectrum.guidebook.dimension.shale_: A sedimentary rock composed of, well, layered shale and clay. Pretty unspectacular, besides being nice to look at.
You can form Shale-Clay into many decorational blocks via [#](bb00bb)Crafting[#]() or the [#](bb00bb)Stonecutter[#]().

Polishing Shale Clay brings out a nice, grayish color.\
Though it seems to [#](449900)weather over time[#](), when exposed to the elements (direct sunlight, rain), returning its natural brownish tint.
By applying heat, all blocks can be converted back to their clean, polished variant again.
Looks like farmland, tastes like farmland, but is poorly suited to use as such. You can plant crops on it, but they will never grow an inch.
Incredibly soft, moist soil. Smells like earthworm.
Ever-moist farmland, with a lot of nutrients. Plants thrive on it.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.name: Enchanting
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.big_c:
Your new magic fishing rods have the interesting property of attracting even living creatures. Why wasn't that a thing with your boring rods? I don't know.\
With this enchantment, you can further increase the chance of catching living creatures.

Increases the chance to reel in living creatures when fishing.\
\
Max Level: 3\
Applicable to Spectrum's Fishing Rods.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Big Catch by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.

Upgrading Big Catch from level 1 to level 2 is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.clove:
Every now and then you are lucky enough to have an enemy leave behind a single rare item.\
The connection of [Clovers](entry://general/clover) and [Light Blue Pigment](entry://general/pigment@light_blue) to luck allows you to increase those chances dramatically.

Higher chance to get rare loot drops, like [#](bb00bb)Iron Ingots[#]() from Zombies.\
*May even increase your chances of getting the most valuable of drops?*\
\
Max Level: 3\
Applicable to melee weapons.\
Mutually exclusive with Looting.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Clovers' Favor by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.

Upgrading Clovers' Favor from level 1 to level 2 is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.confl:
The problems you used to have with enchanting your items with multiple, conflicting enchantments are behind you.\
As a master of magic, nothing is left to your desires.

You are now able to use the enchanter to apply enchantments to your equipment that are normally mutually exclusive.\
\
Be aware:\
*Such actions will require a lot of experience*.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.creat:
Using [Pigment](entry://general/pigment), selected ingredients and some experience the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter) enables you to add Enchantments to [#](bb00bb)regular Books[#]().\
\
While this process consumes more experience than enchanting in a common Enchanting Table you have granular control about which Enchantment you want to create.
You can also use this process to enchant your magical tools.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.curse:
Your tools with this enchantment seem to dissolve all things they mine into thin air. Broken down into the finest sand and blown away by the wind.\
\
When you want to knock half a city out of rough stone, it might even come in handy. Some things are probably a curse and a blessing at the same time.

Destroys the drops of all broken blocks.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Curse of the Void by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.disar:
The Zombies you encounter every night wear lots of valuable equipment. But when they die, it disappears never to be seen again.\
\
No problem if you manage to snatch it from them while they are still alive. Gotcha!

Small chance for mobs (and other players!) to drop their equipment when hit.\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to melee weapons.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Disarming by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.

Upgrading Disarming from level 1 to level 2 is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.encha:
In your search for the perfect tool, you've found that the [#](bb00bb)Enchanting Table[#]() often doesn't do your bidding. Using this highly modified Enchanting Table should resolve most of the issues you had with your original one.[#]()\
\
It allows you to:
- [create new Enchanted Books](entry://enchanting/creating_enchanted_books)
- [upgrade them](entry://enchanting/upgrading_enchanted_books)
- [enchant items without consuming Enchanted Books](entry://enchanting/enchanting_items)
The Enchanter needs a focus structure to work.

Dimensions: 11x11x5 blocks\
Can be enhanced by placing [Upgrades](entry://magical_blocks/upgrades)[#]() on the four Gemstone Blocks.

- 1 Enchanter
- 8 Item Bowls
- 4+ Liquid Crystal Buckets
- 4 Polished Gemstone Blocks
- 8 Gemstone Lamps
- 12 Polished Pillars
- 24 Polished Slabs
- 159 Polished Blocks\
\
*Enhance the Enchanter with Upgrades by placing them on the Gemstone Blocks.*

Using the Enchanter to enchant items is fairly easy:\
Place [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Books[#]() onto the [Item Bowls](entry://decoration/item_bowl) and the item you want to enchant on the Enchanter itself.\
\
Unlike regular enchanting, this will not consume the books - but will require a far greater amount of experience in exchange.
Finally supply a steady stream of experience via [Knowledge Gem](entry://enchanting/knowledge_gem) and you are set.

You can also use this mechanism to create new [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Books[#](). Just put the [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Book(s)[#]() you want to copy in the [Item Bowls](entry://decoration/item_bowl) and a [#](bb00bb)simple book[#]() onto the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter).\
\
Because of the mundane nature of the books this will require lots of experience, though.

You estimate a value **between 50 and 200 experience in most cases per enchantment**.\
Other factors affect this, too: like how rare the enchantment is, it's level and how well the target item can absorb enchantments.\
Interferences, such as enchantments that are not suitable for your target, further increase this cost.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.exube:
That fancy book table of yours, while useful, more or less swallows every piece of experience as soon as you acquire it. Satisfying its never diminishing hunger to supply your ever-growing list of enchanted tools is a monumental task.\
\
Squeezing the last bit of experience out of your opponents will help a lot.

Increases dropped XP for actions taken with the tool, like killing mobs, fishing, and mining ore.\
\
Max Level: 5\
Applicable to melee weapons, mining tools and Spectrum's Fishing Rods.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Exuberance by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.

Upgrading Exuberance from level 1 to level 2 is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.first:
All it takes is a single well-considered hit... or so the saying must have gone.\
\
Whatever.\
On a related note: you invented First Strike. It will be a great help especially against many weak opponents.

Greatly increased damage if the target has full life.\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to melee weapons.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with First Strike by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.

Upgrading First Strike from level 1 to level 2 is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.found:
You still remember the first days in this world, when you laboriously knocked coal out of the stone to melt your mined ore. But those days are numbered, you vowed. The future is now, old man.\
\
Everything comes with a price, though: you'll lose the experience you'd normally get from smelting the ore.

Automatically smelts broken blocks. Used on a [#](bb00bb)Fishing Rod[#]() sets its hook on fire.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools and [#](bb00bb)Spectrum's Fishing Rods[#]().\
Mutually exclusive with Silk Touch.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Foundry by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.gilde:
Gilded books serve as an alternative to mundane Books for enchanting in the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter).\
Being much more receptive for magic, the enchanting process will be both faster and cheaper.\
They can even be used to copy enchantments from all kinds of Items in the Item Bowls around the Enchanter onto itself (not just from other Enchanted Books).

*All is not gold that glitters.\
These books, however, are.*
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.impro:
You already noticed that you deal significantly more damage to enemies if you jump while attacking.\
To further improve those jump attacks, you have developed this enchantment, which increases the additional damage even more.

Additional damage when dealing crits.\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to melee weapons.\
Mutually exclusive with Sharpness.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Improved Critical by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.

Upgrading Improved Critical from level 1 to level 2 is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.indes:
You've come this far and you still have to deal with the fact that your common tools like [#](bb00bb)Flint and Steel[#]() keep breaking once you use them too many times. And you have more than enough equipment which was previously too fragile to use for long.\
With your full armada of nearly-indestructible items now, though? No problem.

Makes a tool fully unbreakable, not taking damage anymore.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to all tools.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Indestructible by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.inert:
You'd almost think this enchantment breathes a little bit of life into your tools.\
\
Like a living creature, the tool gradually gets used to the block you are mining and specializes in it. In return, however, the mining of other blocks becomes slower.

Decreased mining speed. Speed increases with each block mined of the same type.\
\
Max Level: 3\
Applicable to mining tools.\
Mutually exclusive with Efficiency.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Inertia by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.

Upgrading Inertia from level 1 to level 2 is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.inexo:
You have come a long way and nothing can stop you. Except for the few times in Ocean Temples with mining fatigue, slowness, mining underwater, in the air and other adverse conditions...\
\
*Hm, written out like this, that was a bit more than expected*.

Prevents mining speed slowdowns (on tools) or movement slowdowns (on chestplates).\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools and chestplates.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Inexorable by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.inven:
If you got a [#](bb00bb)Dirt Block[#]() whenever you mined an ore and it fell right into [#](bb00bb)Lava[#](), you'd have a whole lot of [#](bb00bb)Dirt[#]().\
No idea what you would do with that much [#](bb00bb)Dirt[#](). Maybe give it to a friend who has just arrived here and needs shelter on his first night?\
Anyway, the dropping stuff into [#](bb00bb)Lava[#]() thing has to stop. Oh yeah, Lava! Same with every [#](bb00bb)Ghast Tear[#]() dropping into it, too.

Puts broken blocks and mob drops directly into your inventory instead of dropping them onto the ground.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools, shears, weapons, bows, crossbows, tridents and Spectrum's fishing rods.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Inventory Insertion by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.overc:
Your familiarity with both magic and the [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() has opened new doors for you:\
[#](449900)Overchanting[#]().\
\
Packing so much magical energy into a single [#](bb00bb)Enchanted Book[#]() will be expensive. *Very expensive*.

- Clovers' Favor: 3 → 6
- Disarming: 2 → 4
- Exuberance: 5 → 10
- First Strike: 2 → 5
- Improved Critical: 2 → 4
- Inertia: 2 → 5
- Tight Grip: 2 → 4
- Treasure Hunter: 3 → 5
- Sniper: 2 → 4

- Bane of Arthropods: 5 → 8
- Blast Protection: 4 → 8
- Depth Strider: 3 → 3
- Efficiency: 5 → 8
- Feather Falling: 4 → 6
- Fire Aspect: 2 → 4
- Fire Protection: 4 → 8
- Fortune: 3 → 5
- Frost Walker: 2 → 4
- Impaling: 5 → 8
- Knockback: 2 → 5
- Looting: 3 → 6
- Loyalty: 3 → 4
- Luck of the Sea: 3 → 5

- Lure: 3 → 5
- Piercing: 4 → 8
- Power: 5 → 8
- Proj. Protection: 4 → 8
- Protection: 4 → 8
- Punch: 2 → 5
- Quick Charge: 3 → 5
- Respiration: 3 → 6
- Riptide: 3 → 4
- Sharpness: 5 → 8
- Smite: 5 → 8
- Soul Speed: 3 → 4
- Sweeping Edge: 3 → 7
- Thorns: 3 → 6
- Unbreaking: 3 → 6
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.pest_:
On your way to the End you found a huge underground structure that looked like the fortress of a civilisation that lived far before you.\
\
Although they seemed to have technology that allowed them to open a portal to another world, they definitely should have done something about their vermin problem.

Gets rid of Silverfish when breaking [#](bb00bb)Infested Blocks[#](), dropping double XP.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools.\
Mutually exclusive with Resonance.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Pest Control by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.razin:
Even with a list of enchantments that you can barely read anymore due to its length, there are still a few blocks that escape your gaze of superiority.\
\
[#](bb00bb)Obsidian[#](), you are getting cancelled today.

Higher mining speed the harder a block is to break.\
\
Max Level: 3\
Applicable to mining tools.\
Mutually exclusive with Fortune.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Razing by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.

Upgrading Razing from level 1 to level 2 is fairly cheap at first.\
This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and experience for each additional level.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.reson:
There have always been blocks that you were very interested in, but you could never carve them out of the ground carefully enough to retrieve them flawlessly. You noticed, however, that these blocks vibrate in a similar way to the gems you've been so concerned with lately.\
If you hit the right frequency, you can finally hold some of those blocks in your hands.

Uses gentle vibrations to allow some blocks to either drop themselves or preserve special properties.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to mining tools.\
Mutually exclusive with Silk Touch, Fortune and Pest Control.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Resonance by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.

The smaller gem buds are usually too fragile to be broken from their mother block.\
\
However, if you hit the right frequency, the small buds will break from the stone almost by themselves, as if you used [#](449900)Silk Touch[#]().

Breaking Ores with Resonance directly drops [Pure Resources](entry://general/pure_resources)[#]() instead of Raw Ores.\
\
This would stack with Fortune... if you somehow could combine these 2 mutually exclusive Enchantments.

Colored Leaves get stimulated in a way to release a lot more [#](bb00bb)saplings[#]().\
\
Applied to a hoe this will finally be your key to get [Colored Saplings](entry://general/colored_trees)[#]() renewably.

In the depths, you have come across cages that seem to spit out an endless number of enemies. What madman put them there, what purpose they serve, and whether it was worth it is a mystery to you. But you can certainly find some use for them. Their creator hopefully won't miss you taking a few.
This immensely sturdy stone found in underground cities can be harvested.
Sculk Shriekers retain their ability to summon the Warden.
Brushable blocks retain their loot and can be brushed later.

The gentle vibrations lull the silverfish hiding in the blocks.\
\
You can pack up the blocks including the silverfish and take them with you, without them knowing what is happening to them.\
Sweet, sweet revenge?
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.snipe:
Compared to the [#](bb00bb)Bow[#](), the [#](bb00bb)Crossbow[#]() maintains a rather inconspicuous existence.\
\
With the Sniping Enchantment however, the crossbow becomes a deadly ranged weapon.

Increases damage, accuracy and projectile speed.\
\
Max Level: 2\
Applicable to Crossbows.\
Mutually exclusive with Multishot.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Sniping by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.stead:
Knowing you, you will create the perfect tool for yourself, only to have it fall into lava in a moment of derangement. And then there is the dimension of the Endermen, which dramatically punishes every mistake.\
\
This new enchantment will protect your favorite tools in case of such an emergency (including throwing it against a cactus).

Protects tools from all kinds of damage when on the ground, even from Lava or falling into the Void.\
\
Max Level: 1\
Applicable to all tools.

You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Steadfast by surrounding your [Enchanter](entry://enchanting/enchanter)[#]() with [Pigment](entry://general/pigment)[#]() and the other required materials.
book.spectrum.guidebook.enchanting.tight:
